intro: Polycnemum mesembryanthemum, commonly known as the starry knotweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its adaptations to arid environments. It has a creeping growth habit with stolons that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread across rocky or sandy soils. Its ability to store water in its leaves makes it well-suited for drought conditions.
